title: [Feature] Android Sharesheet
body:
Implements #2902 partially.

We cannot [exclude oC from sharing targets till API 24](https://developer.android.com/training/sharing/send#excluding-specific-targets-by-component), so we'll keep the previous behaviour for API <24, and use sharesheet for newer ones.

Old code will be removed when we upgrade min_sdk_version to api 24.

title: Fix remote service exception
body: Fixes #2953

title: Potential fix to anr related with camera uploads retries
body:
It may fix #2561 according to logs.

We have this log:
`Context.startForegroundService() did not then call Service.startForeground(): ServiceRecord{24fee0 u0 com.owncloud.android/.files.services.FileUploader}`

This code determines if it is needed to call startForegroundService.
`if ((isCameraUploadFile || isAvailableOfflineFile || isRequestedFromWifiBackEvent) &&
                Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= Build.VERSION_CODES.O) {`

In the retry function, we launch a foreground service but we send only `isRequestedFromWifiBackEvent`. If it is not, `startForegroundService` is not called in the FileUploader.

With this change, we will send how it was created, and if it was created by camera uploads, it will call `startForegroundService`

title: [New Arch] Migrate OCFile to new database
body:
To continue with the new architecture, we will need to migrate completely the old file database to the new one (Room).

This step will help us to develop the other synchronization issues faster, because we won't need to take care of two different databases and different ocfile models.

But this migration has different inconveniences since OCFile is present everywhere, and we will need to disable some functionalities until we finish completely the rearquitecture.

1. FileDataStorageManager handles every old database queries. So we will need to transform those operations to usecases. Some of them are currently planned, others may require new issues. Including:
- Get file by path, id.. #2957 
- Get folder content #2956 
- Get images from folder #2956 
- Save folder/file #2958
- Remove file/folder #2864 (includes local removal)
- Move file/folder #2865 (includes local move)
- Copy file/folder #2866 (includes local copy)
- Conflicts management
- Av. Offline management
- Shared by link management

2. Since the main idea is to release a version once we complete the rearquitecture, we could disable some features temporarely in the new_arch/synchronization branch, and work in different issues. For example:
- Camera Uploads
- Downloads #2872 
- Uploads
- Av. Offline synchronization
- DocumentsProvider integration

Once we have a compiling version, @jesmrec could start QA on each single functionality instead of waiting till the end of sync rearquitecture.

### PR
- App
- Library (if needed)

title: [BUG] OAuth2 + av. offline. Sometimes POST request to renew is not sent
body:
This comes from report in[ 2.15.1 ](https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2914#issuecomment-658268082)release: 

I'm able to reproduce by following these steps, but it's not straightforward. 

1. Add an OAuth2 account. It is a good idea to decrease the expiration time (i set 120 secs). I set several items as av. offline. I don't know if this will be relevant, just commenting to be more precise.
2. Let the token renew some times (two is enough)
3. Kill the app
4. Leave the device during some time. I did about half an hour
5. Reopen the app. 

At this point, the request is sent, we have a `401` , but the token request to renew is not sent. So, the account is frozen. It is not posible to authenticate against OAuth2 (basic auth accounts work fine)

![Screenshot 2020-07-15 at 11 53 00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14894746/87531377-ed2e1800-c691-11ea-8468-34e533cbea2b.png)

Huawei P20, Android 9
Pixel2, Android10
Nexus 6P, Android7

title: Request previews for file types announced in Capabilities endpoint
body: Blocked https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/31267

title: Request previews for EVERY file type
body:
I assume there's a hardcoded list of filetypes where the Android app requests thumbnails/previews. Depending on the server setup, previews for more file types can be provided. The only way to make sure the Android app shows previews for all files the server supports, is to request previews for EVERY file type. Android app will receive 404 in case there is no preview. (same approach as in new iOS app and in Phoenix web UI)

In the future, server-side could announce in the Capabilities what file types have previews: https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/31267 (not implemented yet)

title: Use public preview API
body:
Currently (2.15), Android is using only thumbnails as part of the previews. (private API)
Request is ´api/v1/thumbnail/448/448/<path>´(private thumbnail API)

It could switch to the the public preview API:
`remote.php/dav/files/[user]/[file]?x=[width]&y=[height]&c=[eTag]&preview=1 `
(but there's no real urgency)

title: faster releases, even for testing purpose
body:
Open source doesn't mean to be slow.

What's about a fast release CI, to test and solve stuff much faster ?
This means
* every commit to `master` release automatic a version to Google Playstore **alpha** channel
* every tag release automatic a version to Google Playstore **beta** channel
* when someone decide, it's good, it will be manual moved to Google Playstore **release** channel

This implicit 
* a change in release versionName, similar like 999454800457b807c Otherwise it will keep the slow current mechanism
* apply a publish gradle plugin https://github.com/Triple-T/gradle-play-publisher
* changes in CI, best with Github actions
* optional a global error catcher (eg  #2726 It's an additional issue) 
* optional change in current git branching behavior, no more continue release branch.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3314607/89131036-532bf380-d50a-11ea-94e4-a0dc26b8c5fe.png)


Benefit
* less release overhead
* ability to test in alpha channel by user
* Google tests every commit too
* More testers (alpha and beta testers), means more error finding
* faster release to user 
* bundle resources to new features, instead of current endless release management 


## I could do this, if you want speed up your development

Go in touch with me, if  you want it @michaelstingl

title: Replace custom share dialog with Android Sharesheet
body:
Custom dialog has been replaced with android shareSheet 

after some research i have found this task could be implemented in two diffrent methods

First          : create A custom **BottomSheet** with ActivityIntent Adapter and follow the same implementation of the old 
                   DialogFragment 

Secound : make use of android **Sharesheet**
    **so**  my choice setteled with **ShareSheet** as it provide more consistency for users across apps
      **Please note** that android Sharesheet documentaion state that we should not customize our shareSheet to display our own 
      list of share targets , but it is considered but with alittle twist when we exluded **OwnCloud** package from the intent List 
      and **added** "CopyToClipBoardIntent" , but this twist won't effect the shareSheet standards as we **did not exclude** any of 
     Acquired **intents** of the **sharedIntent**


this approch has been tested in diffrent simulators with diffrent SDK vertion  and it's result has been compared with 
the old dialogFragment 

this approched has been refactored and applied  only for  the case illustrated by @abelgardep   #2902 
as the old DialgoFragment  **aka** "ShareLinkToDialog" is still getting used by another action **sendDownloadedFile(OCFile file)** 
but it is still applicable to adopt our soultion  if required

New version is displayed

Android version: Android 10

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Redirection callback from OAuth2
body:
When users have two (or more) different oC apps in the device, the OAuth2 redirection is always the same and user is force to select which of the apps should be opened. 

Android system will ask for that, and user can choose if the selection is `Always` or `Just Once`. In case the selection is `Always`, no matter which app triggers the OAuth2 authorization flow, from now on the redirection will point to the same (the chosen one).

So, the redirection, `oc://android.owncloud.com` should be brandable and code must be adapted for that.

Any further ideas and thoughts are welcome.

title: [New Arch] Download a single file
body:
Synchronization epic: https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2818

AC:

- By tapping a file in the list, a copy of the remote file is downloaded and stored in the device. 
- If the file is currently downloaded, check before if  new version exists in the server.
- Notifications: many notifications can happen at the time if many files are downloaded. They can be grouped from 3 different (pending to check)
- Progress bar to be updated during the action with the %. Also visible in the notification. 
- Once the file finishes to download, notification is gone.
- Errors in download shown in notification
- File is previewed after being downloaded

Errors: 

- No connectivity
- Server unreachable
- Error servers (file was remotely deleted, moved, maintenance mode)

### TASKS

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Add "Sync now" at automatic photos upload
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Sometimes I am connected with a slow wifi connection so I had to disable OC running in background otherwise after connecting to the network it starts to sync photos. While syncing, the network is impossible to use.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
It would be helpful for me to completely disable "running in background" (for example with checkbox in settings tab) and add button "sync now" to the upload tab. 

**Additional context**
Currently, it is not very user-friendly for me. When I disabled running in background and I want to sync my photos, I have to wait some time with display on to start syncing. A simple button would help me.

### TASKS

- [ ] Add checkbox "running in background" to the settings tab
- [ ] Add button "Sync now" to the upload tab (show only when running in background is disabled)

title: [New arch] Increase test coverage
body:
We are working on the new architecture, and meanwhile we are creating tests. This way, it will be easier to debug and find potential bugs before merging a PR, or releasing a new version.

Android Studio let us know how many test coverage we have. But only for unit tests. We can check this coverage performing next action:

![how_to](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47524927/75443103-03e10600-5961-11ea-9590-c12112745ce2.png)

Once all tests finish, a new tab appears and shows the test coverage in that module.
For example, this would be the test coverage for domain module at the moment. 

### Domain module
This module can be tested completely using unit tests.
Coverage Result: 82% lines and 50% classes
We have around 100% use cases test coverage and we can improve this general coverage testing those exceptions. 

![domain](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47524927/80566030-47ec9780-89f2-11ea-8e03-4e4e3ddb0c0c.png)

### Mobile module
Since this module is where old architecture resides, and most of the tests here are instrumented, the test coverage is pretty low yet.

**But** if we move to the package where we have started working on new architecture, we can see that those new viewModels have a good test coverage.

![mobile](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47524927/80566340-0d372f00-89f3-11ea-83a3-39918c3b2ccf.png)

### Data module
This module is a little bit tricky for test coverage. Since here we have some tests that are instrumented.
Result: 16% lines and 38% classes coverage

![data](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47524927/80565683-5e462380-89f1-11ea-9709-3343cace5def.png)

**But** we can move to shares package for example.
There, we can see that excluding db package where instrumented tests are, unit tests coverage for repository and datasources is around 100%.

![shares-data](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47524927/80565769-9e0d0b00-89f1-11ea-998a-0d1aa52ddd15.png)

### To sum up
We have a decent unit test coverage for the new architecture modules but we can easily detect where we can increase it. The goal would be to have around 100% test coverage with unit tests.

title: Upgrading from old endpoints. Some tests and results.
body:
After releasing 2.14 version, let's do some retrospective in the upgrading for app versions with old endpoints, that's it, versions older than 2.9 ``` Old endpoint: remote.php/webdav/
New endpoint: remote.php/dav/files// ``` Upgrading matrix was totally correct: | From..To | 2.9.3 | 2.10 | 2.11 | 2.12 | 2.13 | 2.14 | | :-------: | :---: | :--: | :--: | :--: | :--: | :--: | | 2.6 | OK | OK | OK | OK | OK | OK | | 2.7 | OK | OK | OK | OK | OK | OK | | 2.8 | OK | OK | OK | OK | OK | OK | An specific upgrading scenario was reporting here https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2787 So, the scenario of upgrading from 2.6 to 2.13.1 was also recorded. The final result is OK. In the video you will see the following steps (using the creation of a folder as operation) 1. In device, 2.6 version is installed (you will see in the User-Agent) 2. Creation of a folder called "Test1" (MKCOL operation), by calling the old dav endpoint, as you can check in the mitmproxy flow. 3. Upgrading to 2.13.1 4. Creation of a folder called "Test2". In this case the endpoint is the new one. [upgradeFrom2.6.zip](https://github.com/owncloud/android/files/4065793/upgradeFrom2.6.zip) I noticed one issue: 1. Install an old-endpoint-supported-version (<2.9). No matter the server version. 2. Upgrade to 2.14.1 Current: app crashes, but after restarting it works properly. Expected: no crash Time difference between release 2.8 (latest old-endpoint-supported-version) and 2.14.1 is 18 months... so, it will not be a usual case to upgrade from one to the another one. Does it worth to check and fix the issue for the following versions @michaelstingl ?

title: Problems found while migrating CERNBox to 2.13.1
body:
Hi,

We're working on the release of 2.13.1 to our CERN community and there were a couple of issues that we found.
Please keep in mind that we have our own implementation of the backend (REVA), which differs from the OC10 server, so some of these issues are not bugs _per se_ but what we see as limitations.
I can open some of them in separate issues if you prefer.

## 1. App crashes looking for parent
If I have a folder, I would expect dav to return `httpd/unix-directory` as `d:getcontenttype`. This is actually something that is present in the new REVA/OCIS ([propfind.go#L230](https://github.com/cs3org/reva/blob/e56f28d27e3d0aaedc3d193e4415c0248d0c38b3/internal/http/services/owncloud/ocdav/propfind.go#L230)).
But, if I return this, the app crashes [here](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/88089179b0f10b491174524850bac5e4874a6a2d/owncloudApp/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/datamodel/OCFile.java#L517) with `parentPath` null.

## 2. App fails to load shares
Due to our storage infrastructure, where files might live in different storage instances and fileIDs are not shared between them,  `item_source` and `file_source` have the format `InstanceName:FileID`, for example `home:123456`. This works for both the web and sync clients.
But on the mobile app, when getting the shares of a file (`GET ocs/v2.php/apps/files_sharing/api/v1/shares`), the app gives an error and displays nothing. This happens because it tries to convert file/item source into `Long` ([ShareXMLParser.kt#L246](https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/blob/9a806469c5a0289494fbf8dae3491d632ae8c53e/owncloudComLibrary/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/lib/resources/shares/ShareXMLParser.kt#L246) and [ShareXMLParser.kt#L263](https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/blob/9a806469c5a0289494fbf8dae3491d632ae8c53e/owncloudComLibrary/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/lib/resources/shares/ShareXMLParser.kt#L263))

## 3. App uses the old webdav endpoint
When we released 2.13 into our beta channel, our testers (including me) were updated from the version 2.6.0. Everything seemed to be working fine, until someone tried to install the app in a fresh device (and when I removed my account and added it again).
What happened was that the people who updated still used the old webdav endpoint (`/remote.php/webdav`) and the people who started clean used the new one (`/remote.php/dav/files/`), which was not compliant. After discussing this in the OC chat, I was informed that the app should always use the new endpoint and is not compatible with the old one. So this is a Bug that need to be fixed before we release the update to everyone else.

## 4. App freezes when app switching
If I opened OC, switch to another app and tried to return to OC, the app froze and I had to close it and open it again.
I cannot reproduce this problem anymore, maybe there were some leftovers in the device like the ones reported in 3.. Maybe it was caused by the fact that the app was using the old webdav endpoint, I'm not sure. I'll report back later if I manage to reproduce it again.


### Environment data
Android version:
10
Device model: 
OnePlus 6T
Stock or customized system:
Stock
ownCloud app version:
2.13.1
ownCloud server version:
CERNBox/REVA

title: [BUG] Authentication info lost. Authentication failed. Auth retry does not end
body:
### Actual behaviour
I see that file edits on my android do not get synced any more (they do not appear on my Windows Desktop). I open the android app on the phone to see what is going on. The app shows: authentication failed. I touch the provided "edit account"(my own translation from German app) and enter my password again. App shows that it it tries to log in... and does not get to an end for minutes. Neither success nor fail, just spinning...  I close the app and try again. Problem repeats. Stays that way for a few days. I even lose a file that I created on my android and that is gone now.

Now during bug reporting I try again several times. After trying like 5 times and turning the phone down for several minutes and then picking it up it suddenly authenticated.

In the months prior: (history of the problem, may not be relevant) the app already did ask to authenticate again, but succeeded. Like every few days or several times a day. In fact it seemed to be the behavior as in https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2356 , but that is just my impression. And then in worsened for me so that I could not log in any more. hence the bug report.


### Expected behaviour
- app does not lose my auth info
- app, if it loses my auth info, is able to log me in again after I re-enter my password (I tried via laptop browser successfully, so server seems to be fine. using same wifi as android, so internet connection seems fine)
- app, if not able to log me in again, does not keep on spinning for minutes but tells me what the problem is

### Steps to reproduce
Those would be nice, but it does not happen consistently. suddenly the app cannot log in.

### Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
Good idea, but right now it works anyway.

### Environment data
Android version: 10

Device model: google pixel 3a

Stock or customized system: stock. bought it, accepted the upgrade to android 10 that the phone offered me.

ownCloud app version: v2.13.1 release 6a5f775cf ... found this after a long time in settings. Why settings! the version is not a setting, is it!

ownCloud server version: version.php has ...

$OC_Version = array(10,0,10,4);
$OC_VersionString = '10.0.10';
$OC_Edition = '';
$OC_Channel = 'stable';
$OC_VersionCanBeUpgradedFrom = [[8,2,11],[9,0,9],[9,1]];
$OC_Build = '2018-09-17T11:07:09+00:00 097d4d22e0cf3341c4923e26453efb32ddedfb24';


### Logs
#### Web server error log
I would give it to you, but how can I be sure that it does not include security tokens? It does contain strings like "requesttoken" and strings that are part of so many lines that they could be a validation that the browser sends with most request.

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
After quite some time I realized that you do not refer to a URL path but a file path. I suggest that you make that clearer in the instructions.

I would give it to you, but how can I be sure that it does not include some security token?

title: Whole UI and UX redesign (ownCloud app for Android 3.0?) [WIP]
body:
[Changes under the hood](https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2351) are necessary but... 

Mobile devices and Android itself are evolving very fast, with larger screens, new user interface patterns, new ways to interact with options... and the ownCloud app for Android is lagging behind in this aspect. I would say that there's at least three key topics to address on this matter:

- The app has the same aspect as many old apps that implemented the material design when it was released for the first time.
- Many options are mainly concentrated at the top of the screen, so with the big size of current devices is harder to reach that part of the screen with just one hand.
- Some primary options are a bit hidden, such as files searching, files sorting and switching between grid or list view.

Following this approach, I've started to work on some new UI / UX concepts for the ownCloud app for Android.

## 1. Filelist

| Old filelist | New filelist |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| ![old_filelist](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/69874634-c74b3300-12bb-11ea-83f2-62522669358f.png) | ![Filelist (resized)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74660679-e0ff6680-5196-11ea-84c9-05e881426945.png) | 

| New filelist | New filelist (dark) |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| ![Filelist](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74660452-72220d80-5196-11ea-9069-37fdbbfcc734.png) | ![New filelist dark](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74233122-67650580-4cca-11ea-989e-f04774a0003c.png) |

- Changes (from top to bottom):
   - **New search bar**, automatically shown without pressing lens icon.
   - **Sort alphabetically, by date or size just above the files**, along with a **small arrow** to make the sorting ascending or descending.
   - **Grid or list view above the files** as well.
   - **Three dots for every file**, in the same row. Tapping this three dots icon will open a bottom menu with the same options that were before in the three dots icon at the top of the view (more difficult to reach with one hand)
   - **New bottom navigation bar** to move between Files, Uploads, Av. offline and Shared by link options, more accessible for the users. These 4 options will no longer appear in the side menu.
  
Note: all the new views will have their respective dark theme versions, related to https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2512

## 2. Sidemenu

| Old sidemenu | New sidemenu |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| ![Old sidemenu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74228273-6c24bc00-4cc0-11ea-9bf3-d485a419a39b.png) | ![Sidemenu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74229130-105b3280-4cc2-11ea-9cb7-0a60944548c0.png) | 

| New sidemenu | New sidemenu (dark) |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| ![Sidemenu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74229130-105b3280-4cc2-11ea-9cb7-0a60944548c0.png) | ![Sidemenu (dark)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74237097-07269180-4cd3-11ea-8a4e-62277933fb7f.png) |

- Changes:

  - **Account management removed** from side menu.
  - Files, Uploads, Av. offline and Shared by link will no longer appear either, just **Settings, Feedback and Help options as well as user quota**.

## 3. Account management

| Old account handling | New account handling |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| ![Old account handling](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74653151-e2756280-5187-11ea-8041-0d2e9ba282f9.png) | ![Account handling](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/74652595-aa215480-5186-11ea-9c26-7c5aa7584971.png) |

## More views...

All opinions and suggestions are welcome

CC / @michaelstingl @jesmrec @abelgardep @ChrisEdS

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Avoid sharing items not allowed
body:
Detected during testing server 10.3.2 version.

The specific scenario is:

1. Add `'share_folder' => '/ReceivedShares'`  to `config.php`. All the shares you receive will be added to such folder
2. Share an item to enforce the creation of the folder

This folder (by definition) is not allowed to be shared. Its permissions in `PROPFIND` response:

`<oc:permissions>NVCK</oc:permissions>`

As you see, the sharing permission (R) is not allowed.

However, you can select it, select a recipient to share with, and finally you got an error:

`Path contains file shared with you`

As improvement, if an item does not have the sharing permission, the share action should be hidden, as well as, for example, we do with shared items when re-sharing is not allowed.

title: [BUG] 2FA can't authorize Android app
body:
**### Actual behaviour**
I set up OAuth2+TOTP apps in ownCloud settings. Then, I am able to successfully authorize the Desktop app on Windows (after I enter my 2FA code in the browser, I close the browser and the desktop clients works). 

The Android app, though, cannot get authorized. After I successfully login via the embedded webbrowser in the Android app (because after login, ownCloud clearly recognizes my name when it wants me to authorize access), the whole procedure fails as it takes me back to the username/password login form with explanation “Wrong username or password”.

**### Expected behaviour**
After writing the 2FA code in Android app's embedded webbrowser, I should be presented with a text such as "successfully authorized Android client" or similar; instead, I am shown "Wrong username or password", i.e. being taken back to the login form after successfully entering username+password and 2FA code. Clearly the login was successful, because my name and surname (account label) are shown in the webpage at the form, yet something makes ownCloud think I can't login.
 
**### Steps to reproduce**
1. enable OAuth2 app (v0.4.1) in ownCloud settings
2. enable TOTP app (2-Factor Authentication - tried on both v0.6.0 and v0.6.1) in ownCloud settings
3. (verify setup by successfully activating a Windows desktop ownCloud client, which works)
4. try to login on Android app (or even remove account and re-add it - it does not work, it's the same)
5. after entering username, password and 6-number 2FA code, it takes me back to ownCloud login screen (in the embedded webbrowser) saying “Wrong username or password”.
6. the Android app actually gets listed under /index.php/settings/personal?sectionid=security#oauth2 but the app itself does not move on from the failed login screen.

**Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?**
No, as the test:test does not have administrative permissions and TOTP+OAuth2 apps are not installed.


**### Environment data**
Android version: MIUI Global 10.3.6 (Android 9)
Device model: Xiaomi Mi MIX 2S
Stock or customized system: stock ROM (OTA)
ownCloud app version: v2.13.1
ownCloud server version: tried on both v10.2.1 (stable) and v10.3.0 (stable)
Additional apps: OAuth2 app v0.4.1, 2-Factor Authentication app either v0.6.0 or v0.6.1

**### Logs**

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Additional nuance for download indicator when local file is out of date
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When a file is not mark as available offline but downloaded locally, it receives a green download indicator. When done once this is fine.
However when the file has changed on the server, I see the mtime change to "a few seconds ago" but the indicator is still green. This many times led me to believe that the file was downloaded already when it wasn't. Also I forgot to mark this file as "available offline" and forgot that an auto-synced file has a pink indicator.

More context: normally one could argue that if I tap the file to open it then it would sync anyway. In my use case it was an APK file which I cannot open through the mobile client for some reason, so I had to resort to an external file manager to open it there. So at the time where I saw that the mtime changed I assumed that the file synced and then switched to the external file manager to install the APK.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Whenever the local file is different from the remote file, I suggest to use a different indicator.
Maybe the indicator could become gray or green but transparent.
The indicator should clearly convey the idea that the files are different and a manual sync might be necessary.
Apart from the reason stated in my "more context" above, I think a user might be preparing from an offline trip and wants to make sure that his important files were already synced (but ones not marked as available offline). They might see the green indicator and believe that they are up to date when they aren't.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
None. Well, or always mark files as available offline.
Or maybe have an option that whenever I open a file through the client it automatically becomes always available offline so that I never run into the green indicator issue.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.


### TASKS

- [ ] Research (if needed): UX research, visual solution ?
- [ ] Create branch feature/feature_name
- [ ] Development tasks
  - [ ] Implement whatever
  - [ ] ...
- [ ] Code review and apply changes requested

- Library (if needed)

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Restore option to move files upon manual upload
body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
Restore the option to move files to the selected ownCloud directory upon uploading files.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
At least keep the file modification time when copying the files, if move is really not possible anymore.

**Additional context**
In previous versions of the app, when I selected files for upload, a question appeared where I could select whether I want to copy or move the files into the local ownCloud directory on the phone. Most often I choose to move the files. It was a very handy feature, for example when I uploaded pictures, they appeared in the exact same space in the Gallery (as their modification dates were the same); then I could easily delete the uploaded files from the Gallery.

Now if I upload a number of pictures, I don't get any question about whether I want to copy or move them; they always get copied. Even worse, the modification date of the copies will be the actual date and not the original dates of the files. As result, all the uploaded pictures move up to present day in Gallery and it's chaos. Then I have a hard time pairing the original pictures to their uploaded copies if I want to delete the local copies to save space; as I don't upload all pictures, and I don't want to accidentally delete ones those are not uploaded.

Note: my actual ownCloud app version is 2.13 release 87ce8f0b7.


### TASKS

- [ ] Research removed code [here](#2479) and check if move option is still available
- [ ] Create branch feature/restore_move_option

  - [ ] Add a new option to move files
  - [ ] Use ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT and delete file [docs](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/providers/document-provider.html#delete) once is uploaded to oC

title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Permission UI handling
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Permissions can not be increased when content is reshared. In case of a shared folder, all its contents must "inherit" the parent folder permissions. 

Currently in Android app, by following these steps:

- User1 shares a folder with User2, granting "share" and "create" permission and revoking "update" and "delete" permissions
- User2 reshares with User3

the current behaviour is:

- By default, shares are created with all permissions granted. To revoke permissions, share must be edited.
- Share from User2 to User3 does not grant any permission by default (only read permission)
- User2 edits his Share with User3. Everything is disabled. If User2 ticks "share" and "create" everything is OK (these are the permissions granted by User1). If User2 ticks "update" or "delete", a snackbar error message is displayed because the permissions are not granted by User1

**Describe the solution you'd like**

> - By default, shares are created with all permissions granted. To revoke permissions, share must be edited.

when a sharee is selected from the list of matches, list of permissions is displayed to be selected by the user to grant the sharee. Permissions by default are ticked/unticked depending values of capability "default_permissions"

> - User3 does not have any permission by default (only read permission)
> - User3 can tick all the permissions. If that permission is not granted, an alert is shown

Only displayed "create" and "share". "Update" and "delete" are hidden or greyed out. 

### TASKS

- [ ] Research (if needed)

title: [BUG] clear all finished in upload view clears failed alse
body:
### Actual behaviour
-when clicking on clear all finished in the upload view all streams are cleared

### Expected behaviour
-only uploaded streams should be cleared from the view
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. upload a few files
2. make some fail and let some upload
3. go to the upload view
4. select clear all finished from the dot menu


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
did not try, but not relevant
